The things that mendicants avoid [mn51:2: Eating at night and food at the wrong time
Dancing, singing, music, and seeing shows
Beautifying and adorning themselves with garlands, perfumes, and makeup
Receiving gold and money, raw grains, raw meat, women and girls, male and female bondservants, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, elephants, cows, horses, and mares, and fields and land
Running errands and messages; buying and selling; falsifying weights, metals, or measures; bribery, fraud, cheating, and duplicity; mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence
The things that mendicants are content w: Robes to look after the body
Almsfood to look after the belly
The things that mendicants act with situ: Bearing the outer robe, bowl, and robes
Walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent
The things that mendicants extend their: Knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings
Knowledge of the ending of defilements
